p: For the current period, the area with a habitat suitability value higher than 0.185 was 1,119 km 2, predominately concentrated in SNJ National Park (722 km 2), the southwest region of the SNJ Forestry District (247 km 2), and the northern region of the Badong Nature Reserve (61 km 2) (Figure 2a). In the 2050s, the suitable habitat area was dramatically reduced to 406 km 2, representing a decrease of −63.7%. The most suitable habitat retreated to SNJ National Park (293 km 2, AC = −59.4%) and the northern region of Badong Nature Reserve (60 km 2, AC = −1.6%). The SNJ Forestry District lost the majority of its suitable habitat, with only 11 km 2 of existing suitable habitat area remaining in the 2050s (AC = −95.5%) (Table 1, Figure 2b).
